title: The King's own borderers :
author: Grant, James
snippet: Dunduff and Carriers brown hill had mist yet resting on their summits, and afar off, paling away to greyish blue, was Ailsa Craig, rising like a cloud from the water — the white canvas of many a ship, homeward-bound or outward-bound, merchantman, privateer and letter- of-marque, like sea birds floating on the bosom of the widening river.

title: Early Travellers in Scotland. Edited by P. Hume Brown. [With maps.]
author: Brown, Peter Hume.
snippet: 1 Dunduff in parish of Maybole, where, acccording to the New StatisticalAccount, smuggling was once actively practised.
